oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - David Spicher - 2018-02-26
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Musicians spotlight program featuring David Spicher from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on February 26, 2018. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: David Spicher; David Greer; Eamon McLoughlin;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments begin in progress with introduction of bassist David Spicher, guitarist David Greer and fiddler Eamon McLoughlin / (02:07) Performs Unidentified Instrumental Song / (04:46) David comments on the band / (05:27) Talks about the history of the upright bass / (06:59) Performs Beaumont Rag / (10:54) Talks about the slap bass technique and plays excerpts / (13:22) Performs I Walk The Line (David Spicer-vocalist) / (15:54) Talks about the swing style of bass playing and plays excerpts / (17:14) Talks about the different types of strings for bass and the different sounds they have / (18:23) Talks about listening with your ears and not your eyes / (19:57) Intros the next song / (20:21) Performs Down Yonder / (23:38) Talks about a trick he did to create an illusion / (25:14) Talks about the evolution of the bass on records, playing bass on country songs and the acoustics of the bass / (27:25) Performs Sixteen Tons / King Of The Road (David Spicher-vocal) /

(36:03) Eamon and David Spicher make a point about playing the bass / (37:04) Talk about Buddy Spicher / (42:01) Back Up And Push / (45:08) Answers question about if he plays fiddle / (46:10) Perform Alabama Jubilee / (49:20) Performs Unidentified Fiddle Tune / (52:40) Performs Estralita featuring walking bass / (57:31) Answers question about playing the blues and demonstrates the style / (59:10) Answers question about the difference in a fiddle and violin / (01:25) Closing comments / (01:01:18) Performs Liberty / (01:03:05) Walk-out Music / (01:03:57) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spicher, David; Greer, David; McLoughlin, Eamon; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
